titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1697: An essay upon the history of Sabeism.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Essay that focuses on the history and religion of the Sabaeans and the Druzes, with discussion of many other world religions and cultures such as those in India, Scandinavia, and Egypt.

msItem.title: An essay upon the history of Sabeism.

author.name: Charles Rainsford Collection of Alchemical and Occult Manuscripts (University of Pennsylvania)

supportDesc.extent: 188 leaves : 198 x 160 (170 x 115) mm bound to 205 x 172 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 188 leaves; [v], 1-336, [xxxv]; contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script in the hand of Charles Rainsford.

binding.p: Contemporary parchment. Front pastedown has come loose from board.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Charles Rainsford (British army officer, fellow of the Royal Society, and alchemist); bequeathed by Rainsford to Hugh Percy, Second Duke of Northumberland.
Sold at auction at Sotheby's (London), 15 July 2014, as part of Lot 411.
Owned by the 2nd through 12th Dukes of Northumberland, ms. 615, Alnwick Castle, Northumberland, 1809-2014 (bookplate, inside upper cover; stamps throughout).
